alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:12AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .As Hurricane Ian moves toward the east central Florida coast early this morning, historic heavy rainfall will continue, leading to quickly rising levels on the Saint Johns River at Astor. At this forecast point, the river continues to rise through Moderate Flood Stage and is forecast to reach Major Flood Stage later today. Levels will reach Near Record Flood Stage of 4.6 feet tonight or early tomorrow morning. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts in the next 24 hours. Due to wind effects and drainage from upstream, the river is forecast to remain in Major Flood into early next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Astor. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, Major flooding occurs, with water entering the first story of many homes and businesses along the river. Some roads inaccessible and rescues likely needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Thursday was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 4.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 2.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Astor 2.3 3.4 Thu 3 am 4.5 4.5 4.0 3.9 4.1 &&
